data.title: Simply Red VIP Tickets & Hospitality UK 2025
data.meta_description: Buy Simply Red VIP tickets & hospitality packages and enjoy a luxury concert experience like no other! Secure premium seats at the Simply Red UK tour here!
data.text:
Experience Simply Redâ€™s musical brilliance live on their 2025 UK and Ireland tour. The band are celebrating their 40th anniversary together. With charismatic frontman Mick Hucknall at the helm, Simply Red has captivated audiences worldwide with their soulful melodies and timeless hits. In 2025, the band is embarking on a highly-anticipated tour across the UK and Ireland, bringing their mesmerizing performances to the stage once again. With performances in Leeds's first direct arena, Manchester's New Co-op Live Arena and Birmingham's Utilita Arena.

If you're a fan of their chart-topping songs like "Holding Back the Years," "Stars," and "If You Don't Know Me by Now," then you won't want to miss this extraordinary experience. By securing VIP tickets with hospitality through Seat Unique, you can elevate your concert experience and indulge in the ultimate luxury. Imagine being treated like a star, with access to pre-show receptions, premium seating, and impeccable hospitality services that will ensure every moment is unforgettable.

Don't just listen to Simply Red's music at home, dive into their incredible live performances and get ready to be swept away by their powerful vocals and contagious energy.

Register your interest now for premium Simply Red tickets and hospitality now at Seat Unique and make memories that will last a lifetime.

Simply Red's UK Tour Dates

Co-op Live - 27th September 2025

Utilita Arena Birmingham - 4th October 2025

Simply Red is a British soul and pop band that was formed in Manchester in 1984. The band is led by singer and songwriter Mick Hucknall, who is the only original member left since the band initially disbanded in 2010. Since their formation, Simply Red has released thirteen studio albums, with all of them peaking within the top ten on the UK Albums Chart.

Under the direction of Mick Hucknall, Simply Red rose to prominence in the UK during the 1980s and 1990s with its soulful and blue-eyed soul sound. The band's music incorporates elements of pop, soul, and jazz, creating a unique and recognizable style. Throughout their career, Simply Red has sold over 50 million albums.

Mick Hucknall, the lead singer of Simply Red, achieved international fame in the 1980s as the frontman and songwriter of the band. With his distinctive voice and soulful delivery, Hucknall has become known for his powerful and emotive vocal performances. He has been a driving force behind Simply Red's success and its enduring popularity.

Throughout the years, Simply Red has delivered numerous hits and memorable songs, including "Holding Back the Years," "Stars," "If You Don't Know Me by Now," and "Fairground," among many others. Their music often explores themes of love, heartbreak, and personal reflection, resonating with audiences worldwide.

It's important to note that the information provided is a general overview of Simply Red and its career. For more detailed and comprehensive information, I would recommend referring to the sources below.

Simply Red's Most Popular Songs

1 - "Holding Back the Years" - This soulful ballad became one of Simply Red's biggest hits, reaching number two on the UK Singles Chart.

2 - "Stars" - The title track from their album "Stars," this song reached number eight on the UK Singles Chart in 1991.

3 - "If You Don't Know Me by Now" - A cover of the Harold Melvin & The Blue Notes' classic, this song became one of Simply Red's signature hits, reaching number one on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart in 1989.

4 - "Sunrise" - Released in 2003, this song reached number seven on the UK Singles Chart and became one of Simply Red's later hits.

5 - "Fairground" - This upbeat track reached number one on the UK Singles Chart in 1995 and became one of the band's most successful singles.

6 - "Something Got Me Started" - Released in 1991, this song peaked at number 11 on the UK Singles Chart and remains a fan favourite.

7 - "Money's Too Tight (to Mention)" - A cover of The Valentine Brothers' song, Simply Red's version reached number 13 on the UK Singles Chart in 1985, solidifying their early success.

8 - "For Your Babies" - Featured on their album "Stars," this ballad became another top 10 hit for Simply Red in the UK.

9 - "The Right Thing" - Released in 1987, this song reached number 11 on the UK Singles Chart and showcased the band's soulful sound.

10 - "You Make Me Feel Brand New" - A cover of The Stylistics' classic, Simply Red's version of this song reached number seven on the UK Singles Chart in 2003.

Simply Red's Most Popular Albums

1 - "Stars" - Released in 1991, this album was a massive commercial success and features hit singles such as "Stars" and "Something Got Me Started".

2 - "Men and Women" - Released in 1987, this album includes popular tracks like "The Right Thing" and "Infidelity".

3 - "A New Flame" - Released in 1989, this album marked a shift in sound for Simply Red and includes the hit singles "If You Don't Know Me by Now" and "It's Only Love".

4 - "Holding Back the Years" - Released in 1985, this debut album showcased the soulful sound of Simply Red and included their breakthrough hit single of the same name.

5 - "Life" - Released in 1995, this album includes the hit singles "Fairground" and "We're in This Together".
